title: Man handling gun while 'rapping' accidentally shoots cousin: JPSO
content:
A 16-year-old Metairie teenager suffered a gunshot wound to the leg after his cousin accidentally shot him during a bedroom rap session, authorities said. Deputies arrested the victim's cousin, Tyronne Smith Jr., 20, of 3534 Paris Ave., New Orleans, and booked him with illegal use of a weapon and negligent injuring, said Glen T. Boyd, spokesman for the Jefferson Parish Sheriff's Office.
The shooting occurred about 2:45 a.m. Wednesday (June 22) at an apartment in the 900 block of Zinnia Avenue in Metairie. The teen told deputies he and his cousin were rapping in his bedroom at the time, an arrest report said.
Smith happened to also be handling a pistol when the gun discharged. The victim was taken to a local hospital for treatment. His condition was not available.
Smith told investigators he didn't intend to shoot his cousin. Neither the teen nor his mother wanted to press charges against Smith.
But deputies took him into custody and booked him into the Jefferson Parish Correctional Center in Gretna. Smith was still being held there Tuesday in lieu of a $5,500 bond.
